data.text:
Thursday 30th January 5.30-7 pm, Leslie Stephen Room, Trinity Hall

Dr Stefan Seitschek (HHStA, Vienna)

ABSTRACT: Archduke Charles of Austria was born in 1685 as the younger son to Emperor Leopold I of Habsburg and his wife Eleonora Magdalena of Pfalz-Neuburg. His diaries from January 1st 1707 until his death in October 1740 have been preserved. This presentation will give an overview of the different issues mentioned in the diaries, including the relationships between family members at the court (wife, children, sisters etc.), illnesses and death in the imperial family, the possible influence of several advisors on Charles, daily routines of the emperor and his court, festivities or diplomatic matters.
